review_title: CBT is a fast paced and ever changing environment that cares about its students
pros: There are always new things to focus on and the job is never boring.  There is great interaction between departments and the employee's are generally good people.  Upper management genuinely cares about the student experience and constantly seeks improvement
cons: On the surface, the college does not compensate the average employee fairly.  Many of the policies regarding compensation, overtime, vacations, etc. are unfairly balanced against the average worker.  There is a definite lack of training for new employees and management is not held accountable for poor decisions or actions.

review_title: Abandon hope all ye who enter.
pros: Not as bad as other vocational schools in Miami for admitting utterly and hopelessly unqualified students.  You could say CBT is best of the worst.
cons:
The nepotism is corrosive, blatant and shameless.  Don't think for one moment that your efforts will be appreciated.  Career advancement is impossible to those who are not blood related to the owners.  Positively medieval.  The school is run like a Mom & Pop hotdog stand.  Compensation is the lowest among any other South Florida technical school.  There is no employee training and the political environment created by the owners / administrators reveals a callousness that is truly maddening. 

There is absolutely no reason to work here.

job_title: College Instructor in Cutler Bay, FL
pros: Management is very supportive of their instructors and more that willing to find solutions.  Small classroom sizes and cutting edge technology.
cons: To be a full time instructor requires teaching blocks of 8am-1 with a long break during the day. And then to return for another evening block of 6-10.  It's a bit grueling and take a while to get used to.
